full_summary:
### Expression of Interest for Low Lift Intake – Screen Replacement and Commissioning of Chlorine Injection

**Project Title:** Low Lift Intake – Screen Replacement and Commissioning of Chlorine Injection
**Contracting Entity:** Correctional Service of Canada
**Location:** Kingston, Ontario, Canada
**Reference Number:** CB-9176-85302835

**Project Overview:**
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking expressions of interest for the replacement of the low lift intake screen and commissioning of the chlorine injection system at the Joyceville Institution.

**Project Description:**
The CSC requires a contractor to replace the existing intake screen, provide a complete inspection of the intake line and chlorine feed line, repair existing shear in the piping, and repair and commission the chlorine injection system at the Joyceville Institution low lift intake.

**Objectives:**
* Replace the existing intake screen with a new one
* Perform a comprehensive inspection of the intake line and chlorine feed line
* Repair existing shear in the piping
* Repair and commission the chlorine injection system
* Ensure continuous water supply to the Institution during the construction phase

**Deliverables:**
* Supply and replace intake line screen as per specifications and drawings
* Repair or replace chlorine injection system and associated controls as a zebra mussel deterrent
* Perform a full inspection of the system as per specifications and drawings
* Ensure environmental mitigation measures are followed and best practices are utilized

**Timeline:**
The contractor must complete the work within 9 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.

**Eligibility:**
All interested suppliers can submit a bid.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selection criteria for this project are based on the lowest price.

**Other Information:**

* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

**Notice:**
This notice was published on September 18, 2023, and the tender closing date is October 3, 2023.

**Attachments:**

* The detailed project requirements are found in Annex F – Technical Specifications and Annex G – Engineered Drawings.
* Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. The seminars are free. Topics include an overview of the federal government contracting process, searching for opportunities
